authors: Tim Arango Is A New York Times Correspondent Based In Los Angeles. Photographs Philip Cheung For The New York Times.
description: As homelessness has exploded, the haves and the have-nots meet on streets, at beaches and in libraries, challenging a cityâ€™s sense of itself.
title: In Los Angeles, Where the Rich and the Destitute Cross Paths
title_page: In Los Angeles, Where the Rich and the Destitute Cross Paths - The New York Times
maintext: In recent years, homelessness has leapt beyond its old boundaries, with more than 53,000 people living without homes this year. This means that Angelenos are encountering homeless people in places they never did before. I drove around the city to see what that change looks like.
